ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Great help and encouragement/newbies
ygData.msgSnippet: ... My first experience in the Bazaar was confusing. I felt like my character was swimming in really thick jello. I looked around and noticed a lot of people
ygData.messageBody:
At 02:50 PM 1/8/2004 +0000, you wrote:
>Wow...thanks so much for the really helpful and encouraging
>replies. I feel so much more courageous ;o) than before...have
>printed off all your tips and will study, yahhhhhhhhhh I have a
>little more guidance now...
>
>I made it to Luclin to the Bazaar, but may be stuck there now...feel
>like a bobble head Paly doll from all the lag. Oh, went to Kunark
>and somehow have lived to tell about it...wandered to what is called
>the wizzy towers or some sort of settlement...hugged the treeline
>all the way back to the PoP spires...reallllly don't want to go back
>there til' I am about a level 60 ;o)! I hope I can get the items I
>want and get back to Greater Faydark sometime before spring...
>
>
>Blue skies,
>Q on Brell

My first experience in the Bazaar was confusing. I felt like my character
was swimming in really thick jello. I looked around and noticed a lot of
people with their faces to the walk. Were they being punished? Hehehe. I
wondered how I could sell anything. I didn't know that I needed a trader's
satchel yet.

On time my video card blew. I had to use the on-board video from my main
board. Needless to say, the graphics capability lacked a lot. My character
is a Val Shir. The main board video chip wasn't capable of handling the
polygons for clothing. All of the female kitty dancers at the campfire in
Thicket were completely nude. I sat down in from to the white tigress for
about 10 minutes and watched her dance. The dances were short but very
entertaining.

Edward Fox
